member.summary: Returns the byte array.

member.summary: Clears the bytes array. Any appended data will be lost. The original byte array size is preserved.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayBuilder.Redim(System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a new byte array of the size specificed. Any appended data will be lost.

member.summary: Array utility class for working with byte arrays.

member.summary: Compares two byte arrays to make sure they contain the exact same data and are the same length.
member.returns: A value of true if the arrays are the same; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.HexEncode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a byte array to a string in 2 character hex format.
member.remarks: e.g. 0x55 ==> "55", also left pads with 0 so that 0x01 is "01" and not "1"

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.HexEncode(System.Byte)
member.summary: Encodes a byte to a string in 2 character hex format.
member.remarks: e.g. 0x55 ==> "55", also left pads with 0 so that 0x01 is "01" and not "1"

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.HexEncode(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encodes a byte array to a string in 2 character hex format.
member.param: Insert colon as the delimiter between bytes.
member.remarks: e.g. 0x55 ==> "55", also left pads with 0 so that 0x01 is "01" and not "1"

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.HexEncode(System.Byte[],System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a byte array to a string in 2 character hex format.
member.param: Insert colon as the delimiter between bytes.
member.remarks: e.g. 0x55 ==> "55", also left pads with 0 so that 0x01 is "01" and not "1"

member.summary: Decodes a 2 character hex format string to a byte array.
member.param: String containing hex values to decode..
member.remarks: Input string may contain a ':' delimiter between each encoded byte pair.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.HexDecode(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Decodes a 2 character hex format string to a byte array.
member.param: String containing hex values to decode..
Number of most significant byte padding to add.
member.remarks: Input string may contain a ':' delimiter between each encoded byte pair.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.GetInt24(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a 32-bit integer value to a 24-bit integer value.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.GetInt32(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a 24-bit integer byte array to a 32-bit integer.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.Clone(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Copies a byte array by creating a new array and transferring the values.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.Reverse(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a copy of the supplied array in reverse order.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.GetLengthSafe(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Gets the length of an array object but does not throw an exception if the array is null.
member.returns: Length of array of 0 if the array is null.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.PadArrayPkcs7(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Pad with bytes all of the same value as the number of padding bytes.
member.remarks: This padding technique is documented in the RSA specification PKCS#5, PKCS#7 as well as the RFC 3852 Section 6.3. This method will paddi with bytes all of the same value as the number of bytes padded. So if you are short by 6 bytes then simply append six bytes of data with the value 0x06. Similarly, if you are short 2 bytes then appended 2 padding bytes with the value 0x02.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.SetOddParity(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Set the least significant odd party bit for supplied byte array.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.SetParity(System.Byte[],Starksoft.Aspen.ParityOptions)
member.summary: Set the most significate parity bit for supplied byte array.
member.returns: New byte array with the correct parity.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.CreateArray(System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates an array of bytes.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.Subarray(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a substring from this instance. The substring starts at a specified character position and has a specified length.
member.param: The index of the start of the substring.
The number of characters in the substring.
member.returns: A Byte array equivalent to the substring of length that begins at startIndex.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.TrimPadding(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Trim zero padding from the right side of the array.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.Clear(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Clears all the bytes in an array by setting the elements to zero and then resizes the array to 0.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.IsHexValue(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if string data supplied is valid hex encoded value.
member.returns: True if string is valid hex encoded value; otherwise false

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.Zero(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Zeros an array by setting all byte values to the value 0.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.ArrayUtils.Xor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Takes two equal size input byte arrays and xors their values and returns the xor result as a new byte array.

member.summary: Combine 2 or more byte arrays into a single, contegious byte array.

member.param: Optional IV value (can be null or empty byte array).

member.summary: Zero pads an array of bytes to specific size.

member.name: T:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient
member.summary:
HTTP connection proxy class. This class implements the HTTP standard proxy protocol.
You can use this class to set up a connection to an HTTP proxy server. Calling the CreateConnection() method initiates the proxy connection and returns a standard System.Net.Socks.TcpClient object that can be used as normal. The proxy plumbing is all handled for you.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient)
member.summary: Creates a HTTP proxy client object using the supplied TcpClient object connection.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. The default HTTP proxy port 8080 is used.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.
Port number to connect to the proxy server.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.
Port number for the proxy server.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.ProxyHost
member.summary: Gets or sets host name or IP address of the proxy server.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.ProxyPort
member.summary: Gets or sets port number for the proxy server.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.ProxyName
member.summary: Gets String representing the name of the proxy.
member.remarks: This property will always return the value 'HTTP'

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.TcpClient
member.summary: Gets or sets the TcpClient object. This property can be set prior to executing CreateConnection to use an existing TcpClient connection.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.CreateConnection(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a remote TCP connection through a proxy server to the destination host on the destination port.
member.param: Destination host name or IP address.
Port number to connect to on the destination host.
member.returns: Returns an open TcpClient object that can be used normally to communicate with the destination server
member.remarks: This method creates a connection to the proxy server and instructs the proxy server to make a pass through connection to the specified destination host on the specified port.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.IsBusy
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an asynchronous operation is running.
member.remarks: Returns true if an asynchronous operation is running; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.IsAsyncCancelled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an asynchronous operation is cancelled.
member.remarks: Returns true if an asynchronous operation is cancelled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.HttpProxyClient.CancelAsync
member.summary: Cancels any asychronous operation that is currently active.

member.summary: Event handler for CreateConnectionAsync method completed.

member.remarks: This method creates a connection to the proxy server and instructs the proxy server to make a pass through connection to the specified destination host on the specified port.

member.name: T:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks4aProxyClient
member.summary: Socks4a connection proxy class. This class implements the Socks4a standard proxy protocol which is an extension of the Socks4 protocol
member.remarks: In Socks version 4A if the client cannot resolve the destination host's domain name to find its IP address the server will attempt to resolve it.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks4aProxyClient.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks4aProxyClient.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient)
member.summary: Creates a Socks4 proxy client object using the supplied TcpClient object connection.
member.param: An open TcpClient object with an established connection.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks4aProxyClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a Socks4a proxy client object. The default proxy port 1080 is used.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.
Proxy user identification information for an IDENTD server.

member.summary: Create a Socks4a proxy client object.

Port used to connect to proxy server.

member.summary: Create a Socks4 proxy client object. The default proxy port 1080 is used.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.

member.summary: Create a Socks4a proxy client object.

Port used to connect to proxy server.

member.summary: Gets String representing the name of the proxy.
member.remarks: This property will always return the value 'SOCKS4a'

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks4aProxyClient.SendCommand(System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream,System.Byte,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a command to the proxy server.
member.param: Destination host name or IP address.
member.remarks: This method override the SendCommand message in the Sock4ProxyClient object. The override adds support for the Socks4a extensions which allow the proxy client to optionally command the proxy server to resolve the destination host IP address.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks4ProxyClient.CreateConnectionAsync(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Asynchronously creates a remote TCP connection through a proxy server to the destination host on the destination port using the supplied open TcpClient object with an open connection to proxy server.
member.param: Destination host name or IP address.
Port number to connect to on the destination host.
member.returns: Returns TcpClient object that can be used normally to communicate with the destination server.
member.remarks: This instructs the proxy server to make a pass through connection to the specified destination host on the specified port.

member.summary: Create a Socks5 proxy client object.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient)
member.summary: Creates a Socks5 proxy client object using the supplied TcpClient object connection.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a Socks5 proxy client object. The default proxy port 1080 is used.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a Socks5 proxy client object.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.
Port used to connect to proxy server.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a Socks5 proxy client object. The default proxy port 1080 is used.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a Socks5 proxy client object.
member.param: Host name or IP address of the proxy server.
Port used to connect to proxy server.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.ProxyHost
member.summary: Gets or sets host name or IP address of the proxy server.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.ProxyPort
member.summary: Gets or sets port used to connect to proxy server.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.ProxyName
member.summary: Gets String representing the name of the proxy.
member.remarks: This property will always return the value 'SOCKS5'

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.ProxyUserName
member.summary: Gets or sets proxy authentication user name.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.ProxyPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets proxy authentication password.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.TcpClient
member.summary: Gets or sets the TcpClient object. This property can be set prior to executing CreateConnection to use an existing TcpClient connection.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.CreateConnection(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a remote TCP connection through a proxy server to the destination host on the destination port.
member.param: Destination host name or IP address of the destination server.
Port number to connect to on the destination host.
member.returns: Returns an open TcpClient object that can be used normally to communicate with the destination server
member.remarks: This method creates a connection to the proxy server and instructs the proxy server to make a pass through connection to the specified destination host on the specified port.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.IsBusy
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an asynchronous operation is running.
member.remarks: Returns true if an asynchronous operation is running; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.IsAsyncCancelled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an asynchronous operation is cancelled.
member.remarks: Returns true if an asynchronous operation is cancelled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.CancelAsync
member.summary: Cancels any asychronous operation that is currently active.

member.name: E:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.CreateConnectionAsyncCompleted
member.summary: Event handler for CreateConnectionAsync method completed.

member.name: M:Starksoft.Aspen.Proxy.Socks5ProxyClient.CreateConnectionAsync(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Asynchronously creates a remote TCP connection through a proxy server to the destination host on the destination port.
member.param: Destination host name or IP address.
Port number to connect to on the destination host.
member.returns: Returns TcpClient object that can be used normally to communicate with the destination server.
member.remarks: This method instructs the proxy server to make a pass through connection to the specified destination host on the specified port.
